intro: Columnea tessmannii, commonly known as the red-tipped columnea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its foliage consists of dark green, glossy leaves that are opposite in arrangement. Columnea tessmannii is prized in horticulture for its ornamental value and is often cultivated for its vibrant blooms.
